title: Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!
brief_description: In 2012, Pussy Riot staged a performance on the soleas of a Moscow cathedral to protest the Orthodox Church’s support of Putin’s election campaign. Though two members were arrested and jailed, the other members of the group made the performance into a music video.

constellations_other.name: Access to resistance
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how access to new recording devices has inspired guerilla filmmaking and protest, helping challenge cultural, societal and political norms.

title_for_label: Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!
description: On 21 February 2012, five members of Pussy Riot staged a performance on the soleas of Moscow’s Cathedral of Christ the Savior. Their actions were stopped by church security officials. By evening, they had turned it into a music video entitled “Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!”. The women said their protest was directed at the Orthodox Church leader’s support for Putin during his election campaign.
